gw.api.plugin

Class StartablePluginBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.plugin.StartablePluginBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, IStartablePlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGeocodePlugin

    public abstract class StartablePluginBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStartablePlugin
    This class may be used as the base class for Java distributed or singleton plugins. It provides all the common code for starting and stopping a plugin. For distributed plugins (annotated with @Distributed), an instance of the plugin runs in every server instance in the cluster. For singleton plugins (not annotated with @Distributed), only one instance of the plugin runs on a server with the appropriate role in the cluster.

    • Method Detail

      • innerStart

        protected void innerStart(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler,
                          boolean serverStarting,
                          java.lang.Runnable startBlock)
        Should only be called from the start(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler, boolean serverStarting).
        Parameters:
        pluginCallbackHandler - Implementation of StartablePluginCallbackHandler that executes as the system user.
        serverStarting - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is starting, false if it comes from the UI
        startBlock - the customer initialization code that should be run at startup
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pluginCallbackHandler cannot be initialized

      • start

        public void start(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler,
                  boolean serverStarting)
        Called during server startup or runlevel change and from the UI. If subclasses have any initialization code that needs to be run, they should override this method so that it:

        1.) includes that initialization code in a lambda expression assigned to the startBlock variable 2.) calls innerStart.

        The call to innerStart will execute the initialization code within the appropriate context.

        Specified by:
        start in interface IStartablePlugin
        Parameters:
        pluginCallbackHandler - Implementation of StartablePluginCallbackHandler that executes as the system user.
        serverStarting - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is starting, false if it comes from the UI

      • innerStop

        protected void innerStop(boolean serverShuttingDown,
                         java.lang.Runnable stopBlock)
        Should only be called from the stop(boolean serverShuttingDown).
        Parameters:
        serverShuttingDown - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is stopping, false if it comes from the UI
        stopBlock - the customer shutdown code that should be run at shutdown (should be idempotent -- able to be called multiple times)

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean serverShuttingDown)
        Called during server shutdown or runlevel change and from the UI. If subclasses have any shutdown code that needs to be run, they should override this method so that it:

        1.) includes that initialization code in a lambda expression assigned to the stopBlock variable 2.) calls innerStop.

        The call to innerStop will execute the initialization code within the appropriate context.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface IStartablePlugin
        Parameters:
        serverShuttingDown - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is shutting down, false if it comes from the UI

        public StartablePluginState getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface IStartablePlugin
        Returns:
        the State of this plugin
